He also told him that he could pick one of them to take home for free in hopes of generating more business. Eric was not one to say no to free stuff, so he collected the gold coin from the table and slipped it in his pocket. Eric was now home. The shopkeeper had explained to Eric how to work the coin. Eric was by no means convinced it would work, but he didn't have anything to lose by trying. So when he got home, he went straight to the garage, where his dad was cleaning his sports-car.

Eric really wanted to spend some more time with him. But Dan was almost always away for work. He figured he could have a lot more fun with the coin at his dad's work. Act like me and think you're me, to the best of your ability.. actually don't think you're me. Just do everything else as I've said." Rachel blinked and shook her head for a second, before finally breaking from her trance for a moment.

"Eric, this is soo stupid. Why are we doing something like this, I don't know seems kinda like a waste of time really." Rachel said. Most of what she said or did was either incorrect or shallow to some degree for the exercise, but Eric could see the effect clearly. "Okay Rachel, you've done wonderfully. Now go back to the chair, but don't strap yourself in and stop acting like me."

"Whatever." Rachel said. She did as she was told and they were back to their original positions.

Eric had analyzed the previous results. It seemed that while Rachel, once again couldn't just 'Be' Eric, that wasn't the result of his command, even for an item bordering on magic. However, what he had seen her do was attempt to be him, which mean imitating, or rather unintentionally mocking him based on what she thought of him and her experiences in the past. If he asked a child to "Become really smart or say smart things.", the result might be cute for sure, but he couldn't bring it to fruition. Than again, if he broke it down and said "Try to become smart. Read a book, ask questions, think harder, and try as hard as you can." He might have better results. If he had requested "Observe me, my life and behavior for one week than act like me." It's possible Rachel could have performed better he reasoned. He remembered reading some myth about people only using 10% of their brains, so maybe they'd actually be able to follow and do things they ordinary couldn't simply because they didn't know how, so long as they're instructed carefully and broken up into small steps.

He tried one more test.

"Rachel, get up and do the following exercises." Eric ordered, and she obeyed shortly after. Every physical pose, dance or act she was able to do, even stand on her hand for a full minute. Well it figures though, Eric thought, she's a cheerleader afterall so of course she's going to be able to do that. It was on a pedestal stand, sealed away underneath a thin plastic covering, with a small post it note reading "For Sale: 49:99$" atop.

"What's this? It looks kinda cool." Whitney said, staring over it.

The shop's owner came over, with his gruff bear weight, beard and ponytail fuzzing about and gave the covering a tap. "Oh this? This is something my nephew found in an old dusty abandon mansion last week. He thought it was cute, but too girly for his taste so he gave it to me. I thought it could be worth something."

"Would it? It'd pay twice that price for a jewel like this! It's so dazzling, I simply must have it!" The studious girl said, looking at it like a dog might stare towards a piece of meat. "Please sell it to me! Please please pretty pretty please!"

"Woah woah, calm down of course I will." The owner said, taking off the covering and bringing it to the register. "If I'd know it would be wanted this much I'd sell it for 5x that, but anyway.."

Whitney forked over the 50$ and proudly bought her newly minted item, gleaming with pink light from within as if it possessed some dark and mysterious power. She thanked the shop owner and soon headed out, making her way home in excitement at her new Pendant.

155332222111111122.content:
She considered issuing an order on herself, just to test out the extent of the Pendants powers.

Pulling out a small mini pocket-mirror from her blush set, she went upstairs away from her family and made sure nobody was looking. She didn't really know if the mirror was even necessary Grasping the pendant in her hands, it glowed a deep pink responding to her natural tenancy to gather desire, and and so did the ring that had manifested onto her finger strangely enough. She held her breath, slowed herself and set about applying her order carefully, whispering and wording her wish through her lips.

"Whitney, you will do take out the trash, do your math homework, pay your brother a compliment, go out for a jog around the block barefoot, and than start eating a cream-cheese bagel (something she'd never eat ordinarly) before waking up and realizing it on your bed."

The ring and pendant flashed purple-pink.
155332222111111122.title: Whitney makes a command

1553322221111111221.content:
Author's Note: More stipulation, or rather speculation on the Pendant. Earlier I'd been reworded that the Pendant's powers, by they hypnotic,mental, or transformational, could effect girls under certain conditions. One of those was 'willingness', that another girl would have to be willing to allow that power to work or it simply wouldn't, and it couldn't force them otherwise. Their basic will could over-ride it. However here we come across a different scenario, one where Whitney is testing it's power on herself. Earlier when she changed her hair-color, it was a simple wish to test it's abilities. However now she's testing it's mechanics and how they might work on herself.

This brings up questions and branching interpretations. Would the Pendant still work on her because she 'Wanted' to be able to effect herself and see it's power used that way firsthand? Or would her intent and will, rejecting those orders (subconsciously or consciously) simply not allow the Pendant to work if she'd find such an action repulsive and unwanted? This chapter branch is for the former interpretation.

Whitney awoke her eyes a second later, finding herself on her bed. It was filled with crumbs and she was in her hoodie. Looking down, she had a half eaten Cream Cheesy bagel in her hands. The taste in her mouth as well, she leaned over and gagged, coughing and disgusted with the lingering flavor she hated so. "But that means, it must have worked!"

Checking over her drawer, her math papers were done completely. Her feet felt rather cold and she could roughly feel like she'd stubbed her toe and was just now realizing it. Running downstairs, the trash was done and put away. Whitney approached her brother with the widest smile, and he leaned back a bit nervous. She could tell he had just had a rather weird interaction with her recently, what nice thing could she have had to say that made him feel uneasy?

It was strange, some vague sense of her remembered. She knew she had done all those things, and felt the time and conscious memory of her doing some part of them, but at the same time those thoughts felt disjointed. It was like her body and mind was on autopilot and she was just coming to her own sort of awareness of it now after following through.

The pendant glowed pink, and the ring on her finger followed. A slight bit of steam gathered up, and the young miss young didn't even notice a silvery bracelet with pink-jewels creating itself over her wrist.
1553322221111111221.title: The command applies

choices: something normal but unusual for Whitney
15533222211111112211.content: Ummm Eric?" Said Whitney walking over to her obviously nervous brother who was pushing himself back into the cushions "I can't quite remember what I said to you earlier, can you remind me?" At this Eric looked shocked "you forgot what you said!?" Shouted Eric in disbelief. Oh this can't be good though Whitney to herself at his reaction. "Well you said...
15533222211111112211.title: Ask about the compliment

choices: eric comes in due to shout
1553322221111112.content:
Whitney furrowed her brow while eating the sandwich that Eric had prepared for her trying to figure out how the magic of the pendant worked.

"When I tried to order Rachel to make me the sandwich nothing happened "said Whitney speaking allowed "but Eric obeyed just fine... What difference is there between them" she pondered "not age" thinking back to the jogger and her neighbour "wait a minute !"shouted Whitney excitedly "it's because she's a gilr. So the pendant makes men do what I say but not women" finished Whitney, beginning to make plans. But then
1553322221111112.title: Trying to work out it's magic

1553322222.content:
How about a "Soul Necklace"? This special necklace comes with unlimited regenerating silver beads that can be detached from it. Once removed from their owner, the beads become a silvery wisp of a flamed orb which they can manipulate, owing to it holding 'essence' within it. They can insert it into other people controlling or in some cases altering them. Once a person has had a bead inserted into them, they can become like a mere puppet or extension of the Necklace owner, who can move their bodies, thoughts and minds about as easily as their own, as if they have a second/third/ect body, although it works on and off. If at anytime they leave a new 'Host' alone, they're go back to retaining themselves and think of their time as possessed as any other, rationing their thoughts and actions as just a part of them. But as long as they still have an orb placed in them they can be re-used and activated as a host anytime. 'Activation' can be as partial as the owner wishes. (Just moving their arms or planting/reading thoughts, up to taking complete control) Orbs can be taken out, switched, and mix-mashed for all sorts of different effects.

A Host when activated follows the Necklace owners will as if by instinct, as naturally as they'd move their own body. The owner will be able to feel, see, hear and so on anything the host do. S/he essentially creates a hivemind with them at the center. Their consciousness can swim through any number of host they've acquired.

Additionally, mental and physical changes are possible to an extent. The basic route might be to plant thoughts, ideas and control a person long enough that they get them to be what you want. But for an easier method, the Necklace let's you alter their mindset and appearance based on the collective pool of host you've acquired. If the owner has captured a sexy cheerleader, a goth or athlete, or smart kind nerd, they can 'Share' these traits with any of their other subjects. And it all registers as perfectly normal to all the host.

Two drawbacks are, if the Necklace is stolen or swapped from it's original owner, whoever wears it next can take control as the center of all the host. If godforbid the Necklace is broken or destroyed during it's use, whoever was it's owner using at the time will be completely utterly 'broken', their mind assaulted by all their host and torn apart, leaving their identity, personality, traits and basic sanity completely torn through the host, and the more of those they have the worse it'd be. (They lose control of it's power and are forcibly ransacked with the minds of countless people they cannot un-link from, and it drives them insane)


Should the Young family or another acquire the Soul Necklace?
1553322222.title: More possible items

15533222221.content: Who shall wield the awesome power of the Soul Necklace?
15533222221.title: The Soul Necklace is found

155332222211.content: Does Eric have the Soul Necklace, or will one of his sisters take control?
155332222211.title: One of the kids

1553322222112.content: Is it the older and wiser Rachel? Or perhaps the younger but brilliant Whitney?
1553322222112.title: Rachel or Whitney

15533222222.content: Ok, before we go visit the boys in the back room for more control items, how about this: the original three items (coin, necklace, crystal ball) but with a different cast?
15533222222.title: Let's switch it up

choices: Nope, bring in the next cast.
155332222221.content:
So, how about this group. Some members of a high school debate team on an overnight trip:

Kyle Smith: 18 years old: An intelligent guy. He would qualify as a nerd, but he doesn't look the part. He's actually fairly good-looking, with long curly red hair and grey eyes. A bit overweight but he hides it well. He doesn't consider himself popular, but he is (compared to some at least.) As a high school senior on the debate team, he is ambitious, slightly power hunger, and slightly insane (or so he claims.) Although he is heterosexual, he has little regard for gender roles. He also practices extreme restraint around girls, it is a rare day to hear him even come close to flirting. As a result, he has several girl friends (friends who are girls), since he is seen as "safe." Of course, this leads to some built up desire that has to be let loose eventually...

Brook Carter: 16 years old: Dyed red hair, blue eyes. She doesn't break any beauty records, but she certainly isn't plain with C cup breasts. She's one of the most genuine people you'll ever meet, and quite intelligent as well. She's good friends with Kyle and used to date Michael, although the breakup was not good and the fallout is even worse. Since she does Lincoln-Douglas debate, she often takes a moral look at matters, although she has her darker side as well. She does her best to look after Lily, as she sees in Lily what could have happened to her.

Lily Reed: 17 years old: Pale red hair, green eyes. She's very short, wears glasses, and has a tattoo on her chest of the word "sneezy." This is because of a strange condition she has where even the slightest contact with her nose causes her to sneeze. She's had a very rough life, having already been married and divorced by her junior year. This has made her extremely weary of relationships, but she is a strong and loyal friend to those who would be her friend. This has made her good friends with Kyle, due to his platonic nature, and Brook, as they have both had relationship problems in the past. Kyle, in turn, is fascinated by Lily and her past, as he has lived a fairly calm and happy life.

Michael Wright: 17 years old: Dark hair, brown eyes. He is of Asian descent, although you wouldn't know by looking at him. A very strange fellow, he has declared himself the "antithesis of FOX News." He is a communist, and a Buddhist (don't ask him how the two ideologies mesh, unless you have a few days to spend.) Although he believes strongly in his ideas and in equality, he doesn't always fit the role. His behavior during his relationship with Brook, and especially afterwords, is questionable at best. He also lacks passion, relying on Kyle's skills at oration to get his message out. Although he is not very well-liked by his fellow debaters, most of them share his ideological views (although those that don't are extremely opposed.)

Liz Dean: 15 years old: Dark brown eyes, her hair color differs week to week, but almost always neon something. She once came out as a lesbian, but has since declared herself pansexual (where attraction occurs regardless of the other persons' sex.) This is largely because she has a strong crush on Kyle, who is the only boy she's ever been attracted to. He knows this, but does not return her feelings. She is rather overweight, and has very large breasts for a sophomore in high school (she could give Agnites Miracle a run for her money!)

There are many others, both on their team and from other schools. The tournament is terribly behind schedule (all debate tournaments are) and so goes long into the night. The tournament is at least two days, possibly more at the rate things are going. All competitors are also packed into a rather small room with only two doors. Since problems can arise from a couple hundred irritable high school students in suits sitting in one room for hours on end, a door leading to the back parking lot has been propped open so students can get some fresh air. Of course, they can do a lot more than that.
155332222221.title: Why Not?

choices: Crystal Ball or a combination of them
1553322222211.content: Great, so which item are we using? Or are we using all of them?
1553322222211.title: Sure, these people seem good.

15533222222112.content: Do you dare to combine these powerful artifacts? What could come of it?
15533222222112.title: Crystal Ball or a combination of them

155332222221122.content: This is going to interesting. So who starts out with the artifacts? Kyle and Brook? Michael and Liz? Someone else?
155332222221122.title: All three

choices: Pay Aaron and Sarah a Visit
1553322222211221.content:
Kyle leaned up against the wall, looking out into the darkness. It was looking back. Reaching into his jacket pocket, he felt the cold metal of the Necklace. No one could have taken it, but he had to keep making sure.

Brook has no idea what we have here Kyle thought to himself. If she did, there's no way she would allow the sort of "experiments" I have planned. She didn't at first as is, but I handled that.

Kyle had the Necklace and Brook had the Coin with her. The Crystal Orb was safe, but not really. There was no way it was safe. Come to think of it, there was no way any of them were safe.

Kyle had just started walking out to his destination, when Roshin emerged from the shadows and walked over.

"Hey," he called. "If coach asks where Aaron and Sarah are, we don't know ok?"

"Fair enough." Kyle didn't really care enough about either of them to turn them in for whatever they might be doing, and it wasn't hard to imagine.

"Still," Kyle asked, "for my own curiosity, what are they up to?"

Roshin glanced over at the empty bleachers just visible in the darkness.

"I don't know for sure, but I left him some protection just in case."

"Are you kidding? Aaron would break Sarah like a twig."

They shared a humorless laugh as Roshin went his way. Kyle stood there for a moment, wondering how it would work. Aaron was more than twice Sarah's height, how would that work? He had planned to test the Necklace under more controlled circumstances, but this might yield an interesting possibility.



Where to next?
1553322222211221.title: Kyle and Brook

15533222222112211.content:
No, better not. If Aaron and Sarah were doing what Roshin assumed they were (and knowing Aaron, that was very likely) it would be best to leave them be. Besides, he already had a plan in place to test the powers of the Necklace.

He walked over to one of the empty school buses a safe distance from the door. The door leaked light into the parking lot, but there was a full moon so it was hard to find some good shadows. It wasn't as cold as he expected from a night in the middle of December. That was good, he was going to spend quite a while outside tonight.

The other had already arrived. Lilly was pacing around near the bus, completely hidden from the door.

"Hello Lilly." Kyle said.

"Oh!" Lilly started. "You scared me."

"Good."

A brief pause ensued as Kyle grasped the Necklace in his pocket.

"So, what did you want to show me out here?" Lilly asked.

"This."

Kyle produced the Necklace. Instantly Lilly's eyes were drawn to the swinging crystal pendent. As soon as she saw it, she couldn't look away. It just drew her in, and made it feel as though a thick fog was spreading through her mind. Her mouth hung slightly open.

"You like the Necklace, don't you?"

"Yess" Lilly replied.

"It seems to draw you in, doesn't it?"

Yess"

"You feel a fog in your mind, leaving you empty and blank, don't you?"

"Yss"

"You're totally in trance, totally under my control, aren't you?"

"sss"

Lilly was totally non-responsive. It didn't matter. Kyle glanced down at the crystal. Images of Lilly swirled through it, indicating it had enthralled her.

"Lilly, whenever I say 'sleep now' you will return to this trance. It doesn't matter where you are or what you're doing, you will drop instantly and automatically. Do you understand?"

"Yes" Given new purpose by the command, Lilly was able to speak again.

Now, what to do with Lilly?
15533222222112211.title: Follow the Original Plan

155332222221122111.content:
Well, what now?

To be honest, Kyle hadn't planned exactly what he was going to do with Lilly after she was entranced. He had been slightly worried it wouldn't even work, so he had put more thought into what to say to back out of the situation than what to do if it went successfully.

Best to keep it simple for now.

"Lilly, whatever I say to you is the absolute truth, isn't it?"

"Yes." She replied.

"Good. Feel your hair growing, cascading down until it reaches your armpits."

Lilly didn't respond, but her red hair quickly did as told, growing until it reached the length Kyle told it to.

Good start, let's see what else we can do.

"Now, feel it turning a pale blonde color."

The hair did as it was told.

“Now feel as your skin grows paler, your eyes get darker, and you become very thin and lithe.”

Everything happened just as he commanded it. She ended up looking like this:

http://images.sugarscape.com/userfiles/i...

“Now, whenever I saw ‘adopt form 1’ you will return to this state. Do you understand?”

“Yes.”

“And when I say ‘adopt form null’ you will return to normal. Do you understand?”

“Yes.”

“Good. Let’s try it, shall we? Adopt form null.”

Instantly her hair shortened and turned red, her eyes lightened, and she became slightly shorter and squat again. She was still in trance, but she had completely changed back into her normal form.
“Adopt form 1.”

And she immediately changed back.

Now, what if the transformation is up to her interpretation?

“Alright, now feel yourself transforming into a sexy Asian girl.”

Immediately she began to change. Kyle didn’t specify what appearance to adopt, so whatever she turned into was Lilly’s idea of a sexy Asian girl.

http://data1.whicdn.com/images/27977477/...

“Lilly, whenever I say ‘adopt form 2’ you will return to this state. Do you understand?”

“Yes.” She said, with a noticeable accent.





What next?
155332222221122111.title: Transform Her

choices: Infinite Power has a Nice Ring to it
155332222222.content: Alright, plenty of powerful artifacts and machines have been turned down to get to this point. You want power, but you're a picky shopper. You've turned down nanites, hypnotic necklaces, and countless other methods of gaining the power you want. So, it's time to unveil the most powerful control artifact in our collection. Are you ready to wield, the Infinity Gauntlet?
155332222222.title: The Big One

1553322222221.content: Alright, should we use the starting cast or a new one?
1553322222221.title: Infinite Power has a Nice Ring to it

15533222222212.content: How about the high school debate team from chapter twelve?
15533222222212.title: Bring Someone New

155332222222121.content: Who should get the Infinity Gauntlet?
155332222222121.title: Yes

1553322222221211.content: Which one of them has it?
1553322222221211.title: Kyle or Brooke

15533222222212111.content:
"Kyle are you sure this is a good idea?" Brooke asked.

"I have no idea. But we still need to try." Kyle replied.

He slid the gauntlet over his arm, then opened the cases containing the gems.

"Here we go." he said as the first gem floated over to him.

"The Reality Gem. Capable of altering anything, transforming anything, nothing is permanent with this."

The Reality Gem locked into place. A surge of power erupted through the gauntlet.

"What did it feel like?" Brooke asked.

" Incredible. "

"Time for the next one, pun intended. The Time Gem, capable of slowing, halting, evening reversing the flow of time for everyone or one."

The same power surge.

"Now for the Mind Gem, the power to know and manipulate the thoughts of others."

"The Soul Gem. A dangerous one, with profound power over others."

"The Space Gem. Teleportation, inter-dimensional travel, any such thing."

"And finally, the Power Gem. Unlimited energy in the palm of my hand."

The gauntlet crackled and sparked with energy as Kyle grinned madly. Brooke looked on in nervousness and awe.

"What's the first thing you're going to do with it?" Brooke asked in a whisper.

"Some security measures. First, no one can see me wearing the gauntlet unless I specifically show it to them." the Mind Gem glowed as its power was used.

"Next, to eliminate the threat of theft I will remove all memory of this device from everyone in the universe."

"And finally, to fuse the gauntlet to my arm. That way it can never be stolen."

Now, for tests.
15533222222212111.title: Kyle

155332222222121112.content:
One final thing, Kyle thought. The Mind Gem glowed as he leveled the gauntlet at Brooke.

"No matter what I do with this power, you will support it. You completely approve of anything I do with it, even to you."

A yellow glow came into Brooke's eyes.

"I completely approve of anything you do with it, even to me."

"Splendid. Now go find Lily please, she'll make an excellent test subject."

"Alright." Brooke said as she went to the building.

Kyle looked down at the gauntlet.

I'm not dreaming, this really is happening. Oh, we'll have all manner of fun with this.

Brooke returned to the meeting spot, Lily just behind her.

"Hello Lily, you can see the gauntlet on my arm." Kyle said.

Lily blinked a few times as she saw it.

"How did I not see that before?" she asked.

"Because I did not want you to. I'm still testing it, and you want to help." Kyle said.

"Yes, I want to help." Lily said.

Kyle grinned. He was getting good at using the Mind Gem subtly. Now for something a little more significant. Kyle raised the gauntlet at Lily and the Mind Gem glowed.

"Ahh! What did you do!" Lily shouted. She started flailing her arms around, even though nothing had changed.

"What did you do to her?" Brooke asked.

"I made her clothes invisible, but only to her. She thinks she's naked." Kyle replied.

"Really, only to her?" Brooke asked with a grin.

"Yes, only to her." Kyle said honestly.
155332222222121112.title: Go find Lily

1553322222222.content: Straight fron Ring Around Gilligan, a bag of one dozen (12) mind control rings, a small super computer, and a remote control! With these, you can turn anyone into an obediant human robot!
1553322222222.title: Mind Control Rings

15533222222221.content:
As he was digging around the attic, Eric found a small, ornate box.

Taking it down to his room, he lifted the lid and there inside were about a dozen rings, of varying sizes. Their designs, however, were all the same.

Each had a gold band with a round, green gem in the top.

Lifting up the foam that held the ring in place, he found a small device, almost like a smartphone, and a remote control. As well as a small note card with writing on it.

Greetings to whomever moved into my home.
These rings are devices of my own invention, which allow you to control the minds of whoever wears them
Using the small computer, you can program the rings, as well as track whomever is wearing the ring. And using the remote will allow you to activate and deactivate the ring, as well as initialize any programming you may have created.
Know that the default function will turn the target into a mindless drone. They will follow simple commands, but nothing overly complex. Nor can you command, say, a personality change. You must use the computer to program those functions in.
I hope you enjoy!

Eric quickly booted up the computer. There he saw 12 tabs, one for each ring. It seemed he could program each individually.

With this all realized, he wanted to test it... but on who?
15533222222221.title: That's the ticket!

info.brief_description: A 19 year old boy gets his hands on various items that can hypnotize people.
info.description:
Many different ancient items have been finding there way to one specific household. Each of these items enables you to hypnotize someone, each with capabilities. Some only affect the mind, some can create illusions, others can cause actual transformations! Listed below is a list of main characters.

The Young family:

Eric Young: 19 years old: This is the main character of our story. Hes fairly nerdy but has a knack for psychology in most of its forms. Overall not a great amount to look at, to confound the issue he doesn't take much time for his appearance.

Natalie Young: 39 years old: Eric's mother, shes extremely attractive for her age, with DD cup breasts and voluptuous curves she can still turn many a heads. She is a housewife with a part-time job (of the authors choosing). She has green eyes and wavy red hair. Shes a very good person with just a little bit of a manipulative side to her.

Dan Young: 42 years old: Eric's father, hes a fairly well-built man, he works out constantly to maintain his strength even passed his glory years. Recently hes purchased a red sports car as his mid-life crisis. Dan doesn't pay very much attention to Eric because he is not following in his athletic footsteps. He works as a very high end car salesmen so he has the highly competitive attitude.

Rachel Young: 20 years old: Eric's older sister, she has followed in her mother's biological footsteps with D cup breasts and a very voluptuous body. Shes extremely popular as the first pick for head cheerleader come her senior year. Despite her popularity and good looks shes surprising down-to-earth, she has a very girl-next-door thing going.

Whitney Young: 18 years old: Eric's younger sister, shes an incredible genius, shes currently finishing the high school curriculum. She has photographic memory, and is going to be majoring in psychology (which she is already working on). Shes an extremely nice person with a little bit of a goth-rocker-nerdy thing going big time geek, because she can read amazingly fast she still has spare time to play all sorts of games and read comics. Shes also fairly beautiful with her mother's green eyes and red hair and C cup breasts, shes already well on her way to continuing the Young tradition of beautiful women.

Feel free to create anyone else, but you can't add to (or take away) from the Young family, unless through a part of the storyline. No killing off main characters.

Here are the various items used to hypnotize people and their special characteristics. For each item there will be a fast and a slow version. Fast means that the hypnosis will be completed in only 1 or 2 sessions, slow means that is will take 2 or more sessions. Sessions must be at least a day apart or you risk frying the persons brain(you can keep this in your story if you want, but I felt this was a tad constraining so don't worry about it). You can only start with one item in each story but feel free in introduce new items or the other already created items to a story once its started.

Coin: This is the traditional hypnosis you can change anything having to do with the mind. There is a secret latch on the coin that causes it too look like it's spinning which is what enthralls people.

Necklace: This is a great deal more powerful than the coin, along with altering the mind, it can create illusions and transform people as long as they maintain a human body (it can't change a person to a inanimate object or animal). You swing the necklace like a pendulum to enthrall people.

Crystal ball: Still more powerful than the necklace, along with the abilities of the fore mentioned items, it can turn people into animals or inanimate objects. You have someone look at the ball for longer than 10 seconds, it will then look like it has various swirls and lines to the person enthralled.

Feel free to make more items that do other things, as long as you keep the underlying hypnosis concept going.

Pretty much anything going, sex, swearing, gay/lesbian, transgender, or a mix of everything. Each addition must be longer than 3 sentences unless your simply creating a either or addition. Use whichever person (1st, 2nd or 3rd) keep grammar and spelling on the up and up. I have the right to edit any post I deem poorly written (in which case I will correct any grammar/spelling errors), however I will not change the subject and will edit it as little as possible to make it make sense.

Other than that go crazy, have some fun with it, hypnosis has always been a favorite of mine!
